required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Evaluation of Facial Cosmetic Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Evaluation of Minimally Invasive Facial Cosmetic Procedures Through Measured Volumetric Changes and Patient Reported Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, trial to quantitatively and qualitatively compare the dermal fillers for the treatment of age related aesthetic changes.

detailed_description.textblock:
Dermal fillers have been approved for the treatment of age related aesthetic changes, including facial volume loss, and attenuation of the static and dynamic rhytid. Despite widespread use of volumizing fillers there is little data quantifying the subjective benefit of these minimally invasive treatments from the patient perspective. Furthermore, there is little data comparing the subjective benefit with true objective volumetric results. Such data will provide much needed information for patient counselling and treatment optimization for patient perceived outcomes.
This study is to determine the patient reported outcomes of three different dermal fillers and establish the volumetric changes over 90 days. Screening will be performed during the patient's office visit. Approximately 100 patients will be enrolled. Patients will participate up to 90 days (Day 1, 14 days, 28 days, and 90 days).

primary_outcome.measure: Patient Satisfaction with validated FACE-Q survey
primary_outcome.description: Patient satisfaction with validated survey FACE-Q

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlate patient satisfaction with volumetric measurements
secondary_outcome.description: regression analysis of satisfaction scores with changes in volumetric measurements
3-dimensional photography to measure volumetric changes in each treatment

arm_group.arm_group_label: Restylane-L®, Restylane-L® Lyft, and Restylane Silk®

intervention.description: Restylane-L® for the indication for mid-to-deep dermal implantation for moderate to severe facial wrinkles and folds, such as nasolabial folds.
intervention.arm_group_label: Restylane-L®, Restylane-L® Lyft, and Restylane Silk®

intervention.description: Restylane-L® Lyft is for the indication of implantation into the deep dermis to superficial subcutis for the correction of moderate to severe facial folds and wrinkles, such as nasolabial folds and malars (cheek/cheek bone area).
intervention.arm_group_label: Restylane-L®, Restylane-L® Lyft, and Restylane Silk®

intervention.description: Restylane Silk® is for the indication for submucosal implantation for lip augmentation and dermal implantation for correction of perioral rhytids in patients over the age of 21.
intervention.arm_group_label: Restylane-L®, Restylane-L® Lyft, and Restylane Silk®

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female patients 40 - 65 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Male patients
- Prior surgical facial rejuvenation procedures
- Facelift
- Neck lift
- Blepharoplasty
- Facial fat grafting
- Prior minimally invasive rejuvenation procedure ≤ 12 months
- Known contraindications to devices or drugs used in this study
- Facial paralysis
- Congenital facial asymmetry
- Pregnant women
- Patient actively taking blood thinners
